body.p: This page describes the configuration of HP 3PAR StoreServ Fibre Channel (FC) or iSCSI storage devices as a Cinder backend. Once the backend is configured you can create and validate the volume.

ul.li: HP Helion Cloud must be successfully deployed. It should be up and running.
3PAR should available in cloud management network or routed to cloud management network with FC and iSCSI ports configured.
3PAR management IP and iSCSI port IP's must have connectivity from controller and compute nodes.

section.title: Configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend
section.p: You must modify cinder.conf.j2 to configure FC driver details.

Perform the following steps to configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend:
Login to deployer node.
Change the directory as shown below:cd ~/helion
Edit cinder.conf.j2 file at hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/templates/cinder.conf.j2 to add 3PAR FC data as follows:enabled_backends=3par_FCAppend this change with the exiting backend, if you have already added VSA as backend.
Copy 3PAR FC section , uncomment it, and modify the values in the cinder.conf.j2 file as shown in the following example:[3par_FC] hp3par_api_url=https://10.1.192.10:8080/api/v1 hp3par_username=helionadmin hp3par_password=helion hp3par_cpg=FC_r5,FC_r1 san_ip=10.1.192.10 san_login=helionadmin san_password=helion volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_fc.HP3PARFCDriver volume_backend_name=3par_FC Please enter the values which are specific to your environment.
Commit your configuration to a local repository:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>" Enter your commit message <commit message>
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Change the directory to ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible and run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml

section.title: Configure 3PAR iSCSI as Cinder backend
section.p: You must modify cinder.conf.j2 to configure iSCSI details.

ol.li: Change the directory as shown below:cd ~/helion

Edit cinder.conf.j2 file at hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/templates/cinder.conf.j2 to enable 3PAR FC as follows:enabled_backends=3par_iSCSIAppend this change with the exiting backend, if you have already added VSA as backend.

Copy 3PAR iSCSI section , uncomment it, and modify the values in the cinder.conf.j2 file as shown in the following example:[3par_iSCSI] hp3par_api_url=https://10.1.192.10:8080/api/v1 hp3par_username=helionadmin hp3par_password=helion hp3par_cpg=FC_r1 san_ip=10.1.192.10 san_login=helionadmin san_password=helion volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_iscsi.HP3PARISCSIDriver volume_backend_name=3par_iSCSI iscsi_ip_address=172.32.0.9 hp3par_iscsi_chap_enabled=true Please enter the values which are specific to your environment.
Execute the steps (5 -7) mentioned in Configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend and Run Cinder Reconfigure Packages as mentioned above.

section.title: Create Volume to Verify the Configuration of 3PAR iSCSI and FC
section.p: You must create a volume to verify the configuration of 3PAR iSCSI and FC. Once you are able to create the volume then delete the created volume.

Perform the following steps to create a volume: <Need to modify the following>
Login to Horizon dashboard.
Create volume type and associate a extra-spec for the volume type with the defined volume_backend_name in the cinder.conf.
Create a test volume from a user account and verify that the volume is successfully created in the "available" state
Delete the test volume.
